IV. DESIGNATED METHODS FOR SUBMITTING CCPA PRIVACY RIGHTS REQUESTS Right to Access

Note: When you make this request, we will send you a link to a ZIP archive which contains a CSV file. This CSV file will contain a copy your information.

To request the specific pieces of your CCPA PI which we have collected in the previous 12 months in readily usable format:

  1. Open the S’more Application
  2. Click ‘Settings’
  3. Click ‘Privacy’
  4. Click ‘Download Your Information‘
  5. Specify where to send the link to the ZIP archive.
  6. Click ‘Send’
  7. Access the link, open the ZIP archive and then the CSV file.
Disclosure of Personal Information

To review a list of the third parties with which the CCPA PI was disclosed or sold in the previous 12 months:

  1. Open the S’more Application
  2. Click ‘Settings’
  3. Click ‘Ad Partners’
Right to Deletion

To request the erasure of your CCPA PI which we have collected, subject to certain exemptions:

  1. Open the S’more Application
  2. Click ‘Settings’
  3. Click ‘Privacy’
  4. Click ‘Delete Your Account‘
  5. Click ‘Delete’
Do not Sell my Personal Information

To opt-out of the sale of CCPA PI, you must uninstall or delete S’more. To delete S’more:

  1. Open the S’more Application
  2. Click ‘Settings’
  3. Click ‘Privacy’
  4. Click ‘Delete Your Account‘
  5. Click ‘Delete’
V. AUTHORIZED AGENTS

You may designate an agent to submit requests on your behalf. The agent can be a natural person or a business entity that is registered with the California Secretary of State.

Authorized Agents are required to verify your identity by providing us with certain Personal Information as described above, depending on whether you hold an account with us and the nature of the information you require, which we will endeavor to match the information submitted to information we maintain about you. Additionally, we will require that you provide us with written confirmation that you have authorized the agent to act on your behalf, and the scope of that authorization. The agent will be required to provide us with proof of the agency relationship, which may be a declaration attesting to the agent’s identity and authorization by you to act on their behalf, signed under penalty of perjury.

If the agent is a business entity, it will also need to submit evidence that it is registered and in good standing with the California Secretary of State.

Information to identify and verify your agent can be submitted via email to support@smoreapp.co. Please note that this subsection does not apply when an agent is authorized to act on your behalf pursuant to a valid power of attorney. Any such requests will be processed in accordance with California law pertaining to powers of attorney.

VI. RIGHT TO NON-DISCRIMINATION

Airfind does not discriminate against you for exercising any of your rights. If you exercise your rights, we will not:

  • Deny you goods or services;
  • Charge you different prices or rates for goods or services, including through granting discounts or other benefits, or imposing penalties;
  • Provide you a different level or quality of goods or services;
  • Suggest that you may receive a different price or rate for goods or services or a different level or quality of goods or services.

However, to earn the points and qualify for rewards available within this Application, you must agree to share your information as described within this Privacy Policy. The financial incentive we offer is reasonably related to the value of your CCPA PI to us, as determined by Airfind, and is described our Terms of Service and within the Application.

If you wish to opt-out of any financial incentives or the selling or sharing of your Personal Information by us, third party advertisers, or our third-party survey partners, please UNINSTALL and DELETE this Application.

VII. CALIFORNIA CIVIL CODE SECTION 1798.83

California Civil Code Section 1798.83 permits the users of the Application who are California residents to request and obtain from us a list of what Personal Information (if any) we disclosed to third parties for their direct marketing purposes in the preceding calendar year and the names and addresses of those third parties. Requests may be made only once a year and are free of charge.

If you are a California resident and would like to make such a request, please submit your request in writing to Airfind at the following address:

Airfind Corp
Attn: Legal Department
3401 N. Miami, Ave, Suite 230
Miami, FL 33127

8. COOKIE POLICY



The S’more website (http://www.smoreapp.co/)uses cookies, web beacons, pixels, and other tracking technology (collectively “Cookies”). This Cookie Policy describes the information we collect through Cookies, how we use it and how you can manage your Cookie Preferences.

This Cookie Policy applies to the S’more website located at http://www.smoreapp.co/. By continuing to access or use the S’more website, you agree to our use of Cookies. The S’more website uses Cookies and any device which interacts with our website will receive them. S’more may work with third parties to place S’more advertisements on their websites and place Cookies in your browser when you visit their websites.

I. WHAT ARE COOKIES?

A Cookie is a small text file sent to and stored on your internet connected device to identify your browser or store information. A first party Cookie is set up by the website being visited by the user. A third party Cookie is set up by a domain that is not the entity hosting the website. Cookies are widely used to make websites work, work in a more efficient way, and identify and track users.

Web beacons are small graphic images that works with Cookies to monitor web usage, link web pages to servers, interact with emails, and personalize advertising.

II. WHY DO WE USE COOKIES?

S’more and our third parties may use Cookies on our website to improve our website and provide you with the best possible experience. We may use Cookies to enable your navigation of our website and use its features. deliver advertising that is more relevant to you and your interests. monitor the number of times you see an advertisement. measure the effectiveness of an advertising campaign. remember choices that you make. personalize your experience. and monitor web site performance. The information we collect from Cookies also may allow us to identify you across devices, such as smartphones, tablets, computers or related browsers.

S’more may allow third parties to place their Cookies on our websites or within our advertisements. And, your web browser may request advertisements directly from independent third party advertising network servers which do not have a business relationship with us. These advertisements may place Cookies that can view, edit, or set third party Cookies, just as if you had requested a web page from the third party site. S’more is not responsible for the practices, including the use of Cookies, employed by third party websites, mobile applications or online services linked to or from our website, or for the content contained therein.

Third party websites, mobile applications, and online services that you can access on the Internet are outside the control or limits of this Cookie Policy.

III. HOW CAN I MANAGE MY COOKIE PREFERENCES? To provide you with the best possible website experience, we use different types of Cookies. We categorize these Cookies as follows: Cookie Type Description Can these cookies be disabled Strictly Necessary Essential in order to enable you to navigate the website and use its features, such as accessing secure areas of the website. No. Marketing Used to deliver advertising that is more relevant to you and your interests. They are also used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement as well as help measure the effectiveness of the advertising campaign. They are usually placed by advertising networks with the website operator’s permission. Yes. Personalization Allows the website to remember choices you make (such as your user name, language or the region you are in) and provide enhanced, more personal features. For example, a website may be able to provide you with local weather reports or traffic news by storing data about the region in which you are currently located. Yes Analytics Provides information about how a web site performs, how each page renders, and whether there are technical issues on the web site to the web site operator. This storage type generally doesn’t collect information that identifies a visitor. Yes.

You can manage your Cookie Preferences on our website by either interacting with our cookie banner or by clicking on the cookie icon in the lower right-hand corner of the website.

IV. HOW CAN I STOP MY INTERNET BROWSER FROM TRACKING MY INFORMATION?

Most web browsers accept Cookies by default. Depending upon your computer and mobile devices, you may be able to set your web browser to control Cookies. If you do not want to receive Cookies, you may adjust your web browser’s settings to reject or delete Cookies. To do so, please follow the instructions provided by your web browser, which are usually located within the “Help,” “Tools,” or “Edit” menus. Deleting or rejecting Cookies may impact your ability to effectively interact with our website, third party websites or advertisements or otherwise limit your experience.

As a company that follows the DAA Self-Regulatory Principles, we support the position taken by the DAA that many browsers’ default settings are set by their manufacturers and, therefore, do not represent the preferences of consumers. However, you may exercise your preferences as described in this Cookie Policy, including through the use of your web browser settings, blocking cookies and taking advantage of the DAA’s AppChoices tool at http://youradchoices.com/appchoices.

Please note that the S’more website does not respond to web browser “Do-Not-Track” signals.
